Author: c2k#4915
Content: speaking of GTC, if i put a gtc order in barterdex do i have to leave the application open or can i close it?

Author: cipi#4502
Content: application must always be open, else no swap is possible... the txs must be signed when the swap happens and that is only possible as long as the application is running

Author: cipi#4502
Content: i would do the following: get a VPS, install marketmaker, set your desired autoprices and let it run forever üòÉ

Author: c2k#4915
Content: ok ty

Content: you can run 2 guis on same MM - but they most likely it would break - it has worked in the past for Devs- only briefly for testeing - you will need 1 MM for each GUI and probably 1 seed for each. from same IP address.

Author: kmdkrazy#8280

Author: kmdkrazy#8280
Content: MM is MM you can access is through command line or GUI - im guessing the dexes are branching /forking or not updated to same MM

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I would suggest to use seed nodes that are actively managed. it is a small code change or a parameter on startup

Author: ph03nix#3115
Content: can you be more specific?

Author: ph03nix#3115
Content: as i understand, there are networking issues with current mm

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: try using netid that is not 0 using a known reliable server

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in a networking system when the system behavior changes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: people immediately say "the software is broken"

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: however if the software didnt change and the system is not working as before, isnt it a million times more likely that some networking issue is the reason

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: like maybe the SPV server isnt quite working, or the seed node is stuck, etc?

Author: ph03nix#3115
Content: food for thought üçú

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: Like if you are browsing and a site doesnt load, is your first reaction "the browser just got a new bug"?

Author: ph03nix#3115
Content: no

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but with mm, that seems to be the reaction

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there are many servers involved and their state is changing a lot more than an mm that is not

Author: ph03nix#3115
Content: the goal of mm 2.0 is to solve these networking issues?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: did you read what I wrote?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you just asked if it is possible to make a browser that can always load a webpage

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: regardless of if the website is working or not

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: mm2 will improve things as much as it possible clientside, but if the SPV server is down, what do you suggest be done to make the swap work?

Author: ph03nix#3115
Content: i don't have a suggestion or a solution

Author: ph03nix#3115
Content: thinking out loud

Author: ph03nix#3115
Content: if SPV server is down i suggest to use native

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the first step to solving a problem is to actually know what the true problem is

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: mm codebase has been stable for months, so it is unlikely for the code to just spontaneously get a new bug

Author: tolken#2655

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: netid 0 i believe is the only netid in use

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: netid 0 defaults to one of my neglected nodes as the seed node

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe setting it to a reliable maintained node is a good idea

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it can be a month or more and i dont even login to my seed node

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and all of barterDEX/hyperDEX might be defaulting to relying on it.

Could we/should we get this node delegated to be run by someone else if you think it may be in need of more attention?

Content: That said, someone just successfully bought and sold (two trades!)  an erc20 from my bob today! Kmd/salt and salt/kmd!! Thanks to whoever did it!! @lukechilds @artem.pikulin

Author: luke#8628
Content: hello!  is there anyway in marketmaker to have/generate more than one smart address without having to change the passphrase? the impression I got from this document here: https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/komodo/wiki/JUMBLR-Whitepaper is that one passphrase == one smart address for each coin.

Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
@luke That's JUMBLR whitepaper, not marketmaker.
same passphrase in BarterDEX or Agama will always create same address. it can't generate 2.

Author: luke#8628
Content: thanks @SHossain ,  so in order to get a different smart address I need a different passphrase. Is it possible to change passphrases on the fly without having to restart marketmaker (through RPC perhaps?) or does it always require a restart?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: you need to restart marketmaker in order to use different passphrase

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: or use different passphrase in another computer
